Instructions.Text:
First, let's begin by measuring the volume at which you can barely detect the test's sound, starting with your left ear.

You will see four targets light up on the screen.  A sound will play while one of the middle two targets are lit up.  After all four targets have lit up, tap on the target that coincided with the sound you heard.
Now we will repeat the same process for your right ear.

Well done.

Now that we know what a comfortable volume should be for you, we are going to measure your ability to detect small but specific changes among a group of sounds.

Just like before, there will be four targets, but this time, each target will have a sound.  One of the middle two targets will sound just a bit different.  Your task is to identify which middle target played a sound that differed from all of the others.  Let's start with your left ear.

Well done, you're almost finished.

We will now repeat the last test for your Right ear.
